contextId.information: "one silver bowl weighing 70 shekels." If necessary, these weights can be written in modern measurements. "12 ... 24 ... 60." These numbers may be written with numerals instead of with words. (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:translate_numbers]])
"25 years old" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:translate_numbers]])
"at 50 years old" or "when they become 50 years old" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:translate_numbers]])
contextId.quote: at the age of fifty years

contextId.information: This can be stated in active form. AT: "the Canaanites had built Hebron 7 years before the Egyptians built Zoan" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]] and [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:translate_numbers]])
contextId.quote: Hebron had been built seven years before Zoan in Egypt

contextId.information: "After 40 days" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:translate_numbers]])
"12" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:translate_numbers]])
"30 days" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:translate_numbers]])
"20 years old and older" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:translate_numbers]])
"six-hundred and one thousand, seven hundred and thirty" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:translate_numbers]])
"13 young bulls, 2 rams, and 14 male lambs" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:translate_numbers]])
contextId.quote: thirteen young bulls, two rams, and fourteen male lambs

contextId.information: "1,000 ... 12,000" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:translate_numbers]])
These are military leaders who commanded more than 1,000 men but less than 10,000 men. (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:translate_numbers]])
These are military leaders who commanded more than 100 men but less than 1,000 men. (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:translate_numbers]])
36,000 (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:translate_numbers]])
16,000 (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:translate_numbers]])

"16,000 women". It has been stated earlier that all the males and the married women captives were put to death (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:translate_numbers]] and [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_explicit]])
"12 springs ... 70 palm trees" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:translate_numbers]])

"1,000 cubits." If it is necessary to use modern distance units, here is a way of doing it. AT: "457 meters" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:translate_numbers]] and [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:translate_bdistance]])
"42 ... 48" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:translate_numbers]])
